landing_page.title: Should you switch to an electric vehicle?
landing_page.description: This simulator is based on the latest studies and we built it to:
landing_page.description_list_1: simply compare carbon emissions through their lifecycle of most common types of cars.
landing_page.description_list_2: break down misconceptions about the electric car.
landing_page.description_list_3: help you estimate if you should switch to an electric vehicle.

settings.title: Select vehicles and adjust parameters
settings.country_hint: Some countries have a cleaner electricity mix than others. This will impact the emissions of an electric car.
settings.total_distance: Total distance over lifetime of the vehicle (km)

emissions_over_time.summary: A {{minFootprintVehicleName}} starts to be better for the climate than a {{maxFootprintVehicleName}} after {{distance}} km.

hypotheses.title: Hypotheses
hypotheses.description_1: Our model was built thanks to the research of the French consultancy firm Carbone 4. For a full understanding of the hypotheses you can read the publication on their website: [EN] Road transportation: what alternative motorisations are suitable for the climate?.
hypotheses.description_2: For the purpose of this simulator we used a simplified model, focusing on Gasoline and Electricity.
hypotheses.description_3: For the estimation of the emissions caused by battery manufacturing, we used more up-to-date data from ICCT.

open_source.title: Open source
open_source.description: This simulator was released under an open-source license. Feel free to contribute or give feedback by creating issues on the {{githubLink}}!
